articles.title: Jupiter will make its closest approach to Earth in 59 years TONIGHT - Daily Mail
articles.description: The gas giant came closest to Earth in almost 60 years yesterday, and today it will reach opposition, meaning the planet will appear opposite the sun to those on Earth.
articles.content:
Jupiter will appear at its biggest and brightest in decades this evening, as it makes its closest approach to Earth in 59 years.
